documents.document: @lightyouonfire you could go for a swim in that lovely water....
@JamesWickham genuinely astonishing....
@JamesWickham in work. Not to worry chat soon.
@JamesWickham can do that time 24 hours time if that makes sense. Speak to you then.
@JamesWickham hopefully could chat midday my time....
@collettasmith @justinbones @AnnaPykett top top red trousers on demo there....
Fascinating look at top level air travel. https://t.co/y7XmBcdRN0
Great journalism from NZ Herald - turns out @peterthiel is a Kiwi.
@jamiegoode welcome to nz! You here for pinot fest? Warning, this summer weather been crap so far....
Seal can't cope with fame, decides to end it all... https://t.co/8XdmSnFRzK
@gemmagoldfingle If done properly in an NZ style, it's a sausage with one slice of crappy bread wrapped around it...
For added entertainment, you could grab a Reuters terminal with a NZD/GBP cross and watch your Kiwi dollar go furthâ€¦ https://t.co/dNTMYsbufM
@JamesWickham terrible weather here today. Missing this test in favour of SA later in the year.
@lightyouonfire sherlock is something that should be watched and enjoyed with a glass of wine. Not while building flat packs....
@JamesWickham @MorwennaGrills only been up 2! We should Skype chat over the break.
Veritas to close Nosh stores by end of March if no buyer found. https://t.co/mNhrUwf8ze
Bit of a bring out your dead day. Veritas in trading halt, Intueri down 25% to just 3 cents.
Sky shares down 8% on profit warning https://t.co/8DhMGFWfiX
@BryanRoberts72 at least here in nz I can get round it for big events by using a fake UK IP. Might be on talksport?
@BryanRoberts72 suspect the club website will be happy to sell you access to commentary! Which is what it's really all about.
@BryanRoberts72 it's just Europe games. Remember at 5live Liverpool sold champs league commentary to talk sport. They are 1 offs.
@BryanRoberts72 also Europe matches broadcasting rights are not under a broad agreement like league/fa cup. So neg on one off basis.
@BryanRoberts72 it may be the rights they have specifically exclude broadcasting it online.
My local paper relegates key's departure to the nib section. At least it wasn't page 2. https://t.co/oMHWlXZx13
@crossantravels That sir, is not bad. And I live in New Zealand.
@PA may be of interest to a UK audience. https://t.co/uqHYqjlhXB
My story on Oyster Bay to raise prices in the UK. May be of interest @GeorgeMacD https://t.co/uqHYqjlhXB
Owner of Oyster Bay wine says prices will rise in the UK due to fall in sterling. https://t.co/D99eY1yViZ
@PensionsMonkey In NZ where they split the two a few years back. It's just as bad, but now they just blame each other.
@zerohedge Wellington didn't go bounce. Seems pretty minor from here....
@DrGerardLyons Here in NZ, view across spectrum is that TPP is dead. Govt now looking to China with FTA re-negotiation.
@JamesWickham Good ta. Swayed with the quakes for about 30 secs (Pleased I got the piling redone back in the winter)
@JamesWickham Not bad ta. Preparing for the imminent arrival of visitors (from Dec to the middle of March)
@JamesWickham This doesn't bode well for the SA tour of NZ in Feb/March....
@JamesWickham They seemed good against NZ (but that was against NZ)
@JamesWickham Why are Oz so bad at the moment? Although they are never great in Tassie. (Hello from the bouncy bouncy isles)
All shares in the NZX50 now down. Index down 2.2%.
NZX50 heading for freefall.
@tcs0 Yeah, fine for 10 mins in car. Not sure about all day mind.
Commercial radio still creative here. Playing 100 best American songs in what it terms a 'rigged' poll.
One of the joys of nz is election results around the world come in during day. Us elec from 3pm. Very civilised.
Markets in NZ now up 2.3%, back up above correction territory on Clinton relief rally.
@JamesWickham Ah, not till May 2018. So a while yet...
@JamesWickham We can head up to Auckland for a couple of days! There's a one day here I think.
@JamesWickham I'm not sure an England test is in Wellington...
@JamesWickham Forgot the clocks had changed. Lovely sunny day here, pleasant 18 degrees. No one booked in for next summer so far.
@JamesWickham I'm sure it can be arranged. Why are you still awake?
NZ50 now in correction territory. Worst performing stock market in the world at the mo.
@GuyKilty @dwinnera I knew you'd love it. It's a belter.
Excellent insight here into long-term trends in republicanism. https://t.co/oY4AVdqDfZ
.@GeorgeMacD may be of interest. https://t.co/dRF6y6jcDJ
Pumpkin Patch into administration.
Credit cycle in NZ turning. Banks killing zombie companies (pumpkin patch), developments being abandoned https://t.co/h7EJ2veGcc
An early winner: Pumpkin Patch shares halted, shareholders advised shares are essentially worthless. https://t.co/lTY0m4ydNi
Any guesses for which company is going to publish a dire update to investors at 5pm on the Friday of a bank holiday weekend?
.one for @katie_martin_fx..more people making their millions playing fx..https://t.co/G3tKegrd93
NZ SFO says hundreds of potential victims of a South Island Ponzi scheme, 8.3mn involved: https://t.co/XUOx7xz0Ts
NZ shares now down a touch under 8% from Sep's record peak. Given it was trading at around 20X earnings, not sure its a surprise.
Please buy stuff from nz. Only 35% more expensive than last year....#gbp https://t.co/m4b27JMaNQ
The boss of @SparkNZ just gave his executive assistant 6,000 shares. At just over $20k, I'm sure she didn't decline. https://t.co/J7csr9Hw4m
@truemagic68 NZX50 has had a bad couple of weeks. Mainly driven by US lifting rates, but correction had to come at some point.
.@WynyardGroup in a trading halt. Boss has deleted his twitter page by the look of it. https://t.co/zGHMd0en3N
@JamesWickham it's always a good day when the van comes....
Just changed some gbp/nzd for inlaws. Currency trader described me as the calmest person he's spoken to all day.
@YuanPotts 5. I fear your days of political activism are catching up with you.
@YuanPotts Bizarrely, at a dinner party I hosted in Wellington this weekend, two guests knew you. It is a small world.
@seanfarrington nor have I in nz. The hipsters here may have beer and beards, but flatcaps are out.
@stephbreakfast @seanfarrington looking good sean. Slightly dapper almost.
@WalkerSam good luck. If you make it to nz from oz, come say hello.
Weird NZ thing I learnt today: no government has ever won a by-election when the seat was previously held by an opposition MP.
@callummay I still get to watch Dan Corbett on NZ news!
@VFritzNews @BBCRadio4 They fell at the recent global dairy trade auction. And futures in NZ are suggesting prices will fall back.
@Birdyword It's about 35% NZD. Those cheap bottles of sav blanc for a fiver are probably over i reckon.
@byekitty there must be an archivist job going somewhere in the colonies though....
@byekitty I've met a few in NZ as well. Get paid better, hours are better, work/life balance better. Not a huge shock is it...
slightly strange to be writing a currency report that focuses on the kiwi rather than the pound...https://t.co/zvame4BPn7
@rnzBusiness With $16mn of debt coming due in the next 12 months, will it even be trading by the end of FY2017?
@GeorgeMacD Paul theroux happy isles of Oceania is amazingly good. Also captures era of first gulf war well.
@HenryPryor I'm in Wellington. Our market is somewhat calmer.
One for @HenryPryor - the yields in Auckland must now be absolute crap. https://t.co/cqWreEnksz
@JamesWickham If you need to stick down a member who referred you, my share number is 360659. Our house white here https://t.co/DhRgq3Xhfw
@JamesWickham yes. It is amazing. Well worth the 40 GBP.
A candidate for Wellington mayor pitches for my vote thus "A messy end to the world as we know it is inevitable". Definitely my 1 choice.
Looks like spring has arrived folks. The view from the couch while the kiddies nap. https://t.co/6LdvHC4co9
@BBCBenThompson Then go to the canteen and buy your producer a cup of coffee....(go on, they deserve it)
@JamesWickham @willcooper no pints here. It's about 12nzd for less than a pint here. So a test ticket costs about a pint and a half.
@JamesWickham Test at the basin, 1dayer at the Westpac.
@JamesWickham just got my tickets for 1dayer and test match against SA in the summer. Tickets 2-4-1 through my bank. Test ticket about 8quid
@truemagic68 given the collapse against the nz dollar, suspect sav blanc will pick up more than that. Listed wine co here wary.
Wonderful story. NZ health minister denies snorting fake coke at school fundraiser...https://t.co/T5ensXhfvU
@BryanRoberts72 Did you go through LAX at all? An airport so crap it doesn't have any high chairs for babies in its food court.
@seanfarrington or as we like to call it here, 16:15 in the afternoon.
@ChrisMasonBBC That sounds great. I think it's really good to have a bit of time off with kiddies. NZ very open to dads looking after kids.
@ChrisMasonBBC Good ta. Work 16 hours a week for a small biz wire service. Keeps me out of trouble. Just back from Fiji. How are you?
@ChrisMasonBBC As a part-timer now, I really enjoy the time I spent with my two. Apart from when Leo tries to mow Althea down on the trike.
@DavidEasson thought that to. Good on him. Will be a much better player/person as a result.
@VFritzNews it's all good thanks. Glad I moved when I did given the exchange rate. Live is quieter and chilled but nice. How r u?
@paullewismoney a fair point. 90% of elec renewable here so price far less volatile. But also people less conscious of need to save energy.
@paullewismoney Paul smart meters been in NZ for a longtime. Only one tiny new start-up charges you based on the time u use the energy.
Well this should be fun. Going to Fiji on Sunday - Monday's a national holiday to mark their rugby victory...https://t.co/LvvXUqdBY5
